Venerable Vasumitra said.
When he enters his mother's womb, it's called birth.
When he emerges from the womb, it's called appearance.
Metaphorically, these aggregates are called disappearance.
The aggregate at the time of death is called death.
Venerable Buddhadeva said.
Among the destinies, there are two kinds.
When he first receives the body, it's called birth.
The aggregates that are already present in the destinies are called appearances.
He dies in the intermediate aggregate.
In the aggregate that's directed toward birth, this is called nonexistence.
The aggregate at the time of abandoning the life root is called death.
*Abhidharma-vibhāṣā-śāstra, Volume 20
